text: Teri Ann Manolio is an American physician, epidemiologist, and geneticist. She is director of the Division of Genomic Medicine at the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI), as well as Professor of Medicine at the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences. She is a fellow of the American College of Physicians and of the American Heart Association's Council on Epidemiology. She also has a clinical appointment at the Walter Reed National Military Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland. Before joining the NHGRI, she worked on large cohort studies, such as the Cardiovascular Health Study and the Framingham Heart Study, at the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute. ==References== Category:American epidemiologists Category:American geneticists Category:Genetic epidemiologists Category:American women physicians Category:Women epidemiologists Category:Women geneticists Category:University of Maryland, College Park alumni Category:University of Maryland, Baltimore alumni Category:Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health alumni Category:National Institutes of Health faculty Category:Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences faculty Category:People from Bethesda, Maryland Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people
title: Teri Manolio
